title: Publications
text:

Articles

Dragosits, U., Carnell, E.J., Tomlinson, S.J., Misselbrook, T.H., Rowe, E.C., Mitchell, Z., Thomas, I.N., Dore, A.J., Levy, P., Zwagerman, T., Jones, L., Dore, C., Hampshire, K., Raoult, J., German, R., Pridmore, A., Williamson, T., Marner, B., Hodgins, L., Laxen, D., Wilkins, K., Stevens, C., Zappala, S., Field, C. & Caporn, S.J.M. 2020. title: Software Packages
text:
butterfly


An R package for the verification of continually updating timeseries data where we expect new values, but want to ensure previous data remains unchanged.

View Project




asli-pipeline


A pipeline for operational execution of the Amundsen Sea Ice Low calculations, provided in the asli package. The functions in the asli package are described in detail in the package repository amundsen-sea-low-index.
View Project






asli-app


A minimal Shiny application to demonstrate EDS services, using the Amundsen Sea Low Index as a case study.
View Project




basdoc


BAS template for Quarto presentations with reveal.js
View Project






fplboard


Shiny app leveraging Fantasy Premier League’s API data. Developed as a package using the golem framework.
View Project

title: Thomas Zwagerman
text:
Hello there!



  
    

  
  
My name is Thomas Zwagerman. I’m a Research Software Engineer at the British Antarctic Survey. I mostly work in R.
I have previously worked as an Environmental Data Scientist and as a Spatial Data Analyst at the UK Centre for Ecology and Hydrology.
I have a BSc in Ecological & Environmental Sciences from the University of Edinburgh. I wrote my dissertation on vegetation change impact on arctic land-atmosphere interactions and snowmelt in the Arctic.
Research Interests:

FAIR Data and Research Software
Reproducible Research Methods
Open Source Scientific Software
Environmental Forecasting and Digital Twins
